name: Bangladesh
takeaway: The Chinese embassy in Bangladesh is the source of many activities that exert China's soft power on Bangladeshi society.
Bangladesh adheres to the “one-China principle” and firmly supports China on issues related to China's stance on its internal affairs such as Xinjiang, Hong Kong and Tibet.
Visits of politicians, bureaucrats and members of armed forces resumed in 2023 after a ban on foreign visits due to austerity measures.
description-1: In 2023, Bangladesh had a GDP per capita of US$2,529 and a total estimated population of 170.43 million people, with the Chinese population comprising an estimated 100,000 people.
description-2: Bangladesh established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1976. Bangladesh was ranked 165th in Reporters Without Borders’ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 40/100.

Media.evidence: No news developments. No Bangladeshi media in the list
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: We have seen a few examples in 2023 so it deserves a few rating. These journalists have mostly published articles about their visit, Chinese places and the China-Bangladesh friendship. So its a significant PR outreach program.

Media.evidence: There are a few examples found. The 55th year of broadcasting Bangla programs in China's state media was celebrated in January 2024.

Media.evidence: No new change. Bangladesh's media (especially if they have an online outlet - requires government registration). There are some media owners conglomerates who have business with China.
Media.note:
Meghna Group owns Ekattor TV 
Orion Group owns The Business Standard newspaper

Media.evidence: Media partnerships with UNB and BSS. A July 2023 research elaborated how Media representations of China’s Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) formed positive public opinion in Bangladesh.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The Beijing's Global Media Influence 2022 report by Freedom House did not mention Bangladesh.
Media.note: Chinese Embassy pays for the yearly supplements on newspapers in general advertisement rate

Media.evidence: Yes. Many of the reports quoted the Chinese Ambassador in Bangladesh.

Media.evidence: Didn't see any report. There were some protests in Bangladesh - re: Human Rights abuse in Uighur. However, Bangladesh, as member of OIC endorsed the OIC delegation's August 2023 visit to Uighur and accepting PRC's narratives (see link)
Media.note: Not known; rather statements and protests are seen condemning rights violations in Xinjiang; reporters who visit China, particularly Xinjiang, don't campaign for China upon return expect for writing some stories on the visit.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no such official Parliamentary group in Bangladesh. However, it has been observed that the parliamentary standing committee on housing and the ministry of public works vetted China's proposal to build a smart city in a China-Bangladesh partnership on a 60 square kilometer area on the Bay of Bengal coast.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Most of the Chinese aid comes in terms of investment secured by soft loan or commercial loans. However, during Covid-19 pandemic, Bangladesh received free vaccines from China.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There were reports of such tarinings earlier. No report of trainings in this period (2023). The foreign trainings of Bangladeshi civil servants are on hold due to austerity measues.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No such thing observed during the reporting period.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No such thing observed during the reporting period.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: PRC signed a "Strategic Partnership" agreement with Bangladesh in 2016 to implement BRI projects worth around US $27 billion for 26 projects covering Chinese investment in Bangladesh in sectors such as the Belt and Road Initiative, capacity cooperation, telecommunications, energy, electricity, etc. On December 31, 2023, Yao Wen, Ambassador of China to Bangladesh, mentioned in a statement that "China and Bangladesh have jointly carried forward our Strategic Partnership of Cooperation this year".
Foreign Policy.note: China has invested close to $26 billion in Bangladesh between 2016 and 2022. In 2023 alone, China spent approximately $800 million in Bangladesh.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: China emerged as Bangladesh’s biggest trading partner in 2006. Historically Bangladesh adhered to One China policy and there is no mission of Taiwan in Bangladesh. In 2022, China again reminded Bangladesh to stick to its one China Policy.
Foreign Policy.note: In 2022, Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Li Jiming has asked the Bangladesh government to abide by the one-China principle and support China’s position on Taiwan. (Not for publication - internal info - During the first week of January 2024 ahead of the Taiwan election, major media houses in Bangladesh received a message from the Chinese Embassy in Dhaka - quoting a portion- "kindly keep reminded of the One-China Principle, as the official standing of BD government, when covering the news on the election result. Taiwan might be referred to as a region/territory, but not independent, and shall not be called as a nation/country/state."
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: I didn't see any report during the reporting period. But a 2016 article showed that Bangladesh supported China's claim.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Bangladesh had mostly remained silent officially about the Xinjiang issue. However, in 2023, as a member of OIC it has accepted China's explanation about the situation in XInjiang. Also, there have been civil society protests against the abuses in Uyghur.
Foreign Policy.note: Bangladesh did not sign the letter to the UN by 51 countries (in Oct 2023) expressing concerns about Uyghur.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Bangladesh officially supports China's stance on Tibet. However, we have seen civil society protests demanding Tibet's independence.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Bangladesh officially supports China's stance on Hong Kong. However, there were no civil society activity on this.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Only Huawei is building partnership with Bangladeshi Universities and some commercial enterprises in the Fintech and manufacturing sector.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The Shanto Mariam-Honghe Confucius Classroom was launched on Nov 22, 2023. Although it is touted as the first Confucius classroom, the first one was launched in 2006 in collaboration with North South University and the Chinese Yunnan University. The 2nd one started in 2009 with the joint effort of China Radio International (CRI) and Bangladesh's Shanto Mariam Foundation. The 3rd one was established in Dhaka University in 2016.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: No such thing observed during the reporting period.
Academia.note: In 2020, the Chinese embassy in Bangladesh, in collaboration with Bangla Academy and China Media Group, installed the pavilion of China Book House at the Ekushey book fair, the national book fair in Bangladesh.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: We have found only one academic research center and one China center.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.note: Another Think Tank - The Center for Alternatives conducted a survey - "National Image of China in Bangladesh." which was presented to the Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh. Over 60 percent of the respondents have a positive impression on China. We couldn't find evidence whether the survey was sponsored by funds from China.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: 55 Bangladeshi students have received the 2023-2024 Academic Year Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS)

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is only one sister-city agreement between China's Kunming and Bangladesh's port city Chittagong (2019). China's proposal to name 6 sister cities in Bangladesh is yet to be materialized.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There are a few instances of politicians visiting China on invitation or for conferences during the reporting period. The foreign training of Bangladeshi officials were on hold during 2022- mid 2023 due to austerity measures.

Economy.evidence: During 2022-2023, China remained as the top import partner, but export to China remained very low.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: In 2021, Bangladesh's sovereign debt to China stood as 6.81%. During 2021-2023 Bangladesh received an additional US$ 3 billion loan from China - 10% of its annual international borrowing, with a repayment range from 10 years to 15 years. Bangladesh's total loan debt is 172 billion as on September 2023. As per AidData, Bangladesh’s debt exposure to China stands at $17.1 billion as of November 2023, accounting for 4.1% of its GDP.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Bangladesh exports to China include jute yarn, tanned equine and bovine hides, textile thread, fish, crab, Asian swamp eel, rawhide and leather goods, vegetables, tea, coffee, oil seeds. Bangladesh exports 98 types of goods to China in total, with readymade garments making up 60% of the total exports.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Until 2023, Chinese enterprises have built 12 roads and 21 bridges in Bangladesh, with several transportation and power plant projects underway or to be implemented soon. But none of them include critical infrastructure or belong to sensitive sectors.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: The China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) will provide $4.5 billion to Bangladesh in the next five years as Bangladesh seeks softer terms and conditions
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Dhaka Chamber and Commerce Industries Limited (DCCI) is the largest business chamber in Bangladesh. It is part of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce and the Belt and Road Industrial and Commercial Alliance.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Bangladesh has decided to make a loan repayment of US$ 300 million for a Russian nuclear plant in China's yuan. Since Russian banks are largely banned from SWIFT, Bangladesh used a bank account at a Chinese bank that transferred yuan to Russia through CIPS.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: While Bangladesh currently has no bilateral trade agreements active, it is negotiating with a number of countries for finalising the deal, including China. PRC floated the idea of FTA in 2016 and the Ministry of Commerce website placed it under Free Trade Agreements under consideration.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) has been awarded to build the "Chinese Economic and Industrial Zone (CEIZ)" on a G2G basis (direct procurement without tender) on 784 acres of land in Anwara upazila of Chattogram. Bangladesh plans to establish 100 green economic zones to lure foreign investment and to generate 10 million jobs by 2041. China is the top investor in three economic zones already setup in different places in Bangladesh.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Bangladesh's debt with China is low and more investment is in the pipeline.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: China's telecommunication giant Huawei has won a contract in November 2023 to upgrade Bangladeshi state-run cellphone operator (BTCL) Teletalk's network to ensure better coverage in rural areas and 5G readiness. Huawei helped Teletalk launch its 5G service in 2021.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Phase III of Bangladesh's network infrastructure project extending high speed broadband internet connectivity to 2,600 unions was built by Chinese companies under the BRI project and completed in 2022. Mobile network Banglalink signed an agreement with Huawei in 2022 to modernise its network infrastructure.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: The Dhaka Elevated Expressway, partially opened in September 2023. The 19.73-km expressway was jointly invested and built by two Chinese companies and a Thai company. The Padma Bridge Railway link project, the Cox's Bazar Runway expansion project are also being built by Chinese companies. Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman Tunnel, South Asia's first underwater river tunnel built under the BRI project was inaugurated in October 2023.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In 2019, Huawei installed 110 “AI based IP Cameras” in Sylhet under the 'Digital Sylhet City' project. In 2023 alone Huawei delivered over 72 solar projects (132 MW in total) all over Bangladesh. The Bangladesh Smart City Development Project in Mirrersharai is being funded by Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB).
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Three Bangladeshi private companies have been awarded to connect Bangladesh to its 3rd submarine cable to receive 13,200 Gbps from the third undersea cable, SEA-ME-WE 6, by 2025.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no evidence of Chinese firms partnering with small green startups.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Bkash, an established FinTech platform partnered with Huawei in 2023 to Deepen Financial Inclusion in Bangladesh. Since 2017, Huawei has been working closely with bKash in digitalizing its MFS. Huawei also signed an MoU with garment manufacturers to install solar power plants in factories.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Since 2020, China is discussing with a number South Asian countries, including Pakistan, Nepal, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, over adopting the Beidou satellite (BDS) navigation system.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: A few such events were organized by the Chinese Embassy, such as The China-Bangladesh Culture & Art Night and the Belt and Road Initiative in Bangladesh Exhibition 2023.

Society.evidence: There were events by the China Bangla Friendship Center. Also, The Silk Road Chinese Music Concert Bangladesh was held in an University in Dhaka, presented by the artists from the "Golden Bell Star" Ensemble of the Chinese Musicians' Association, featured Chinese folk music performances.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The Chinese Embassy in Bangladesh distributed Qurbani meat to 720 families in July 2023 during the Eid-ul-Azha religious festival. It also donated smart classrooms to two Bangladeshi colleges. The embassy also donated Dengue Fever Anti-epidemic materials to local hospitals.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: China Media Group (CMG) organized "China Festival on the TV Screen" in Dhaka. Award winning Chinese TV shows and animation series have also appeared on a TV channel and one OTT platform.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: Facebook is the top social media platform in Bangladesh with 43.25 million users. Followed by are YouTube with 34.40 million users, Instagram with 4.45 million users, Facebook Messenger with 20.35 million users and LinkedIn with 5.90 million members. Chinese Platform Tiktok was banned in Bangladesh in 2018, but it can be accessible to many users after 2020. No official TikTok stats about Bangladesh are available.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The Chinese Embassy in Bangladesh donated sports goods to Bangladesh Wushu Federation.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The Centre for Alternatives conducted a survey on the "National Image of China in Bangladesh" which was presented in December 2023 in front of the Chinese Ambassador. According to the report, more than 60 percent of the respondents have a positive impression on China. 46 per cent of respondents had a good impression about China and 14 per cent had a ‘very good’ impression.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Bangladesh imports over 70% of its weapons from China, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Bangladesh is a member of the Conference on Interaction and Confidence-Building Measures in Asia (CICA). But there was no summit in 2023.

Military.evidence: No reports about co-development or co-producing observed.

Military.evidence: China has said that it will not build any military base in Bangladesh or any other foreign land.

Military.evidence: China had provided free vaccines to Bangladesh during the Covid-19 pandemic. In 2023, it provided a US$1.5 million contribution to improve hygiene services of Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh. It also provided aid to the Bangladesh Red Crescent Society.

Military.evidence: We could not get definite information about any military training in 2023 participated by Bangladesh forces. But there were some visits.

Military.evidence: In July 2023, Chief of Air Staff of Bangladesh Air Force made a courtesy call to State Councillor and Defence Minister General Li Shangfu, and Air Force Commander General Chang Dingqiu during his visit to China. In September 2023, the Bangladesh army chief visited China to attend 19th Asian Games before his visit to India to attend the Indo-Pacific Armies Chiefs' Conclave (IPACC) where China was absent. In March 2023, Bangladesh Navy Chief Admiral M Shaheen Iqbal visited China and met the Chinese Defence Minister, and  the People's Liberation Army (PLA) Navy Chief.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In Bangladesh, the financial sector confronts an average of 630 cyberattacks daily, with 24% originating from China, 12% from Russia, and 13% from North Korea. Also, hackers associated with China's Ministry of State Security (MSS) have attacked 17 different countries including Bangladesh from 2021 to 2023.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In Bangladesh, the Nantong PSB operates one overseas police service station at an unknown location.

Law Enforcement.evidence: here are reports of the arrest of Chinese citizens on criminal charges. But no deportation was reported.
